symptoms.name: Stiff neck
symptoms.pattern: May be absent in early stages

symptoms.name: Cranial nerve palsies
symptoms.pattern: Common, often involving CN III, VI, and VII

vital_signs.Glasgow Coma Scale: May be 10 or less in advanced stages

physical_findings: Meningeal signs (may be absent in early stages)

lab_values.CSF cell count: Pleocytosis with lymphocytic predominance (median 136/µL in HIV-negative patients)
lab_values.CSF glucose: Low (CSF glucose/blood glucose ratio 0.13 in HIV-negative patients)
lab_values.CSF ZN stain: Low sensitivity (11% positive in one study)
lab_values.CSF culture: Low yield (36% positive by solid culture, 44% by liquid culture in one study)

risk_factors: Living in areas with high prevalence of pulmonary tuberculosis

imaging_findings.Chest X-ray: Suggestive of active or previous pulmonary TB in approximately 50% of cases
imaging_findings.Brain CT/MRI: Meningeal enhancement, hydrocephalus, basal exudates, infarcts, and tuberculomas are common findings

required: Abnormal CSF findings (pleocytosis, high protein, low glucose)
supportive: Positive CSF culture for Mycobacterium tuberculosis
Positive Xpert MTB/RIF assay on CSF
